meanings.definition: A loud, confused noise, especially one caused by a large group of people.
meanings.sent1: The hullabaloo of the children playing in the park could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were filled with the hullabaloo of cars honking and people shouting.
meanings.sent3: The hullabaloo of the party next door kept me up all night.
meanings.sent4: Amidst the hullabaloo of the market, she found a moment of peace.
meanings.sent5: The hullabaloo of the thunderstorm made the dog hide under the bed.

meanings.sent1: There was a hullabaloo in the office when the boss announced the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The hullabaloo over the new policy change lasted for days.
meanings.sent3: The hullabaloo over the missing pen turned out to be a simple misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: She tried to calm the hullabaloo in the classroom by playing a calming song.
meanings.sent5: The hullabaloo of the protest could be heard echoing through the streets.
